NameThatFish is an application that can predict over 20 fish species in North America when you upload or take a picture.
Upload or take a picture and check it out!

questions: How can I upload a picture?
Can I use a photo from my phone?
answers: Go to the 'upload' tab. There are two ways of uploading a picture from your phone. 1. Use the gallery view, and press 'upload image' long enough. Upload your desired picture, and crop. 2. Use the grid view, and press 'upload image' shortly. Upload your desired picture, and crop.

questions: How can I take a picture?
Can I take a photo in the app?
answers: Go to the 'camera' tab. Take a photo. You can also take in a selfie mode! Once done, crop the picture.

questions: Do you save my pictures externally?
Do you save my pictures permanently?
Does the app store uploaded images?
answers: We do not store your taken or uploaded images to any database, though it is stored in your phone's internal cache to persist throughout the use of the app.
You can crop your taken or uploaded images.

questions: What fish species can you classify??
What fish species can you predict?
How many fish can you predict?
answers: We can classify over 20 fish species in North America. They are Atlantic Salmon, Bluegill, Brook Trout, Channel Catfish, Chinook Salmon, Crappie, Flathead Catfish, Lake Sturgeon, Sea Lamprey, Largemouth Bass, Muskellunge, Northern Pike, Not Recognized, Rainbow Trout, Rock Bass, Smallmouth Bass, Sunfish, Walleye, White Perch, and Yellow Perch.
We can predict over 20 fish species. They are listed in the library tab.
